edu.virginia.iath.snac.helpers.datastructures

Class SNACDate

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.virginia.iath.snac.helpers.datastructures.SNACDate

  • public class SNACDate
extends java.lang.Object
    Date storage class for SNAC parsing. This object stores all information about an individual date, including the original string, all modifiers to the date, notbefore and notafter dates, and the output format to convert this date to a string. This object also contains the code to parse the date string (after pre-processing) into a Calendar object.
    Author:
    Robbie Hott

      • isRange

        Returns:
        True if part of a range, false otherwise.

        Returns:
        True if end of a date range, false otherwise.

      • wasParsed

        public boolean wasParsed()
        Checks to see if this date was parsed correctly.
        Returns:
        True if parsed, false otherwise.

      • updateOutputFormat

        public void updateOutputFormat()
        Updates the output format of the string. Use this method after parsing the dates, but before the getting the String of the normalized date. This method formats the date string according to the information available. If there is a season, it does not modify. If there is a decade, it sets the date to return only years. If there is month or date information, it sets the date to return those appropriately.

      • validateParsed

        public void validateParsed()
        Validates this date as truly parsed. Sets parsed to true.

      • parseDate

        public boolean parseDate()
        Parses this SNACDate's date string into the correct Java Calendar objects for the date. If there is an or in the date string, it parses into not-before and not-after dates (with a null exact date). Else, it parses the date directly. If the date was unable to be parsed, it sets the parsed date to null. Empty to-dates (end of a range) are allowed.
        Returns:
        True if date was successfully parsed, false otherwise.

      • parseDate

        private java.util.Calendar parseDate(java.lang.String str)
                              throws java.text.ParseException
        Parses the parameter string into a Java Calendar object. This meothod uses Apache's date parser utilities to catch multiple forms of dates available. This prioritizes for year first, then combinations of month, day, and year in most human writeable forms.
        Parameters:
        str - String to be parsed.
        Returns:
        Calendar object of the given date string.
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - If date cannot be parsed, this method throws the ParseExeption.

      • handleModifiers

        public void handleModifiers()
        Handle all the modifiers on this string. This should be called as a post-processing step after the exact date has been processed. It adds not-before and not-after dates based on the exact date and the following criteria:
        • If the circa modifier is applied, give +/- 3 years
        • If the fuzzy modifier is applied, give +/- 1 year
        • If the decade modifier is applied and the year is a multiple of 100, it's a century, give a range of exact date to exact date plus 99 years (ex: 1800-1899). Clears the exact date.
        • If the decade modifier is applied and the year is a multiple of 10, it's a decade, give a range of exact date to exact date plus 9 years (ex: 1810-1819). Clears the exact date.
        • If the season modifier is applied, look up the season dates and use those as the range. Clears the exact date.

      • getSeasonDates

        private java.util.Calendar[] getSeasonDates(java.lang.String seasonStr,
                                  int year)
        Gets the season dates for the given season and year. Since the season dates only change +/- 2 days across most of time, we store a lookup table and calculate them directly. Winter starts in December of the previous year and ends in the given year.
        Parameters:
        seasonStr - Season to lookup (summer, spring, fall, autumn, winter)
        year - 4-digit year.
        Returns:
        Array of Java Calendar objects containing the beginning and end dates of the season.

        Returns:

      • addModifier

        public void addModifier(java.lang.String modifier)
        Add the given modifier to this SNACDate object. Valid modifiers are decade, season, season identifiers (spring, winter, summer, fall, autumn), fuzzy, and circa.
        Parameters:
        modifier - Modifier string to apply.

      • updateString

        Run a find-replace on the date string to clean it up.
        Parameters:
        find - Regular expression to search for.
        replace - String with which to replace each find instance.
